intro: Mapouria antsalovensis, commonly known as the Madagascar senna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the island's unique ecological conditions. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and supporting biodiversity. Due to its restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
